Title:
Two new species of Arthirinium (Apiosporaceae, Xylariales)
associated with bamboo from Yunnan, China
Abstract:
Arthrinium, a globally distributed genus, is characterized
by basauxic conidiogenesis in its asexual morph forming with globose to
subglobose conidia which are usually lenticular in side view or obovioid
and brown to dark brown in colour. The sexual morph develops
multi-locular perithecial stromata and produce hyaline apiospores
usually surrounded by a thick gelatinous sheath. Four Arthrinium species
collected in Kunming, China, are described and illustrated in this
paper. Based on the morphology and DNA sequence data of the internal
transcribed spacers (ITS) and 5.8S rRNA gene of the nrDNA, two new
species Arthrinium garethjonesii and A. neosubglobosa are introduced,
together with descriptions of sexual morphs of two hitherto described
species, A. hydei and A. hyphopodii. Phylogenetically close taxa and
morphologically similar species are discussed
